goal.ch:
This course provide an opportunity for undergraduate students to study
introductory astronomy in English. It is mainly for (1) foreign
students who is not yet fluent in Chinese and is willing to study
astronomy, and (2) local Taiwanese students who is willing to study
astronomy in English. The goals of this course include, but not limited
to,
(a) knowing properties of various types of celestial objects and understanding underlying physics behind them,
(b) knowing astronomical phenomena and understanding underlying physics behind them,
(c) knowing astronomical techniques and understanding underlying physics behind them.
This course tries to describe astronomical objects and their
properties / phenomena / related observational techniques using high
school level mathematics and physics. Each week, one simple and
fundamental question is raised, and the lecture is given to answer the
question.

outline.ch:
Topics for this course include following.
1. How long is one day, one month, and one year?
2. How to record electromagnetic radiation from celestial objects?
3. How to measure the distance to a celestial object?
4. How to measure the temperature of a celestial object?
5. How to measure the size of a celestial object?
6. How to measure the mass of a celestial object?
7. Why the Earth has its own atmosphere, but the Moon does not?
8. What is the energy source of a star?
9. How were many different elements created?
10. How to know the internal structure of a celestial object?
11. How to find an Earth-like planet outside of our solar system?
12. How to know the size and mass of the Milky Way Galaxy?
13. How to know the age of our solar system?
14. How to know the age of a star?
15. How to know the age of the Universe?
16. What can we learn from latest images obtained by new telescopes?
